rev.comment: Added comments to genre section to try and get people talking, rather than edit warring.

90's albums still weren't really pop rock, they were poppier than their earlier albums but still not pop rock. And anyone who thinks Van Halen is heavy metal has little understanding of what metal is.
/* Out-of-band collaborations between present and former Van Halen band members */ "Present and former" is another way of saying all, and "Van Halen band" is implied by the page title.
/* Hall of Fame induction, reunion tour planned and canceled */ citation cleanup

ok this time they really are fixed...

This page needs to be cleaned up... it's not an article so much as it's a prose timeline
Changed a Source Link in favor of a different one
It can be argued with Hagar/Cherone the 90s albums were pop rock, but no albums were pure metal
All in the main article, and needs citations - this is just fancruft!
/* Recent events */ Rm statements that repeat the obvious
/* Influence on culture, music, and business */
Mark Stone was a member of MAMMOTH, not VAN HALEN. JUST LOOK AT THE NAME OF THIS PAGE. IT'S VAN HALEN, NOT MAMMOTH.
Rephrased intro, rm "American rock band" twice
Rv. Recent unsourced additions evince anti-Hagar POV
Van Halen has always been a hard rock band. They were never heavy metal, never pop metal, and definitely weren't pop rock.
Fixed Excessive Heading Capitalization; toned down POV passage, though it could still be a lot better

Given the references provided on [[heavy metal music]], it's quite clear they are a heavy metal band. "Hard rock" is a rather generic term.

/* Fall 2007 Tour Rumours */ No mention of a September start date is ever mentioned in cited article, only a vague "fall". It is mid July now.
